p: Favilavir is a guanine analog with the broad-spectrum antiviral activities through its selective inhibition of viral RNA-dependent RNA polymerase [ 130]. Favilavir has efficacy against various RNA viruses, including influenza, ebola, yellow fever, chikungunya, norovirus, and enterovirus [ 131, 132]. A recent cell line study suggested its efficacy against the SARS-CoV-II [ 133]. While it got the approval for novel influenza treatment, favipiravir is currently on the clinical trials for COVID-19 treatment by the National Infectious Diseases Scientific Science Research Center and the Shenzhen Third People's Hospital [ 134]. The preliminary results in eighty patients reported the superior efficacy of favipiravir than the lopinavir/ritonavir combination without the significant adverse reactions [ 135, 136].
